newsitem.title: USA: U.S. INVESTMENT CO WINS INTEREST IN AZERI OILFIELD.
newsitem.headline: U.S. INVESTMENT CO WINS INTEREST IN AZERI OILFIELD.

text.p: Palm Beach-based investment company Nevtah Capital Management said it has won an 80 percent stake in an oilfield in Azerbaijan which could have 100 million barrels of potential recoverable oil reserves.
Daniel Kesonen, the president of Nevtah told Reuters that the company intended to raise money from money managers in Europe to finance the development of the field.
He said that that the field was about 75 kilometres north of Baku, the Azeri capital and that the company's joint venture partner was a Chinese company called China Hua Yuan.
"The Azeri reserves were given to us by the State Oil Company of the Azerbaijan Republic and onfirmed by Pen Engineering of Istanbul," said Kesonen.
He said that Nevtah was looking at other potential oilfields in Georgia. ((-- David Chance New York Newsroom 212 859 1902))
